case_name: Father v. Mother: Temporary Child Support Motion
outcome_details: The mother is ordered to pay temporary child support based on an imputed income of $185,000 per year. She is also required to pay 38% of section 7 expenses for the child.

remedy.amount: Based on imputed income of $185,000 per year

decision_factors: The mother did not provide financial disclosure.
The father seeks child support based on the mother's imputed income of $300,000 per year.
The child has been primarily residing with the father since March 2024.
summary: The father filed a motion for temporary child support, seeking contributions from the mother based on an imputed income of $300,000. The court imputed her income at $185,000 due to lack of financial disclosure, ordering her to pay child support and 38% of the child's section 7 expenses.
